alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 7:57AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON PDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern California, including the following areas, in southeast California, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chuckwalla Valley, Imperial County Southwest, Imperial County West, Imperial Valley and Salton Sea. In southern California, Chiriaco Summit. * WHEN...From Noon PDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall creating excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The environment will become increasingly favorable today for thunderstorms to produce heavy rainfall capable of flash flooding. Localized rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be possible this afternoon and evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley
